definition[0]: to not notice something, or not see how important it is
example[0]: It is easy to overlook a small detail like that.
example[1]: Nobody could overlook the fact that box office sales were down.
definition[1]: to forgive someoneâ€™s mistake, bad behaviour etc and take no action
example[2]: She found him entertaining enough to overlook his faults.
definition[2]: if a house, room etc overlooks something, it has a view of it, usually from above
